title: Bug 19089: Missing Popup Menu in Java Editor Ruler (Photon)
description: This bug report pertains to the absence of a popup menu in the Java editor ruler of the Photon version.
OB:
When using the Photon version, the observed behavior, as described in the bug report, is as follows:
1) Open a Java editor.
2) Right-click on the left vertical ruler.
However, the expected popup menu, which should allow users to add breakpoints, marks, and similar items, does not appear as anticipated.
EB:
In the Photon version, users expect that when they:
1) Open a Java editor
2) Right-click on the left vertical ruler
A popup menu should be triggered, offering options to add breakpoints, marks, and other relevant functionalities. Regrettably, the bug report indicates that this expected behavior is not being met.
SR:
To replicate this issue in the Photon version, follow these steps:
1) Open a Java editor.
2) Right-click on the left vertical ruler. The anticipated behavior is that a popup menu should appear, allowing you to add breakpoints, marks, and similar items. However, the report suggests that the popup menu fails to appear as expected.
